intro: Polyosma matangensis, commonly known as the Matang River hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Borneo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments along riverbanks and in dense forests. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
